levels.title: Asset Allocation
levels.subtitle: Capital market expectations, asset allocation, and behavioral finance
levels.description: Develop capital market expectations, apply asset allocation frameworks, and understand behavioral finance impacts.

levels.title: Derivatives and Risk Management
levels.subtitle: Option strategies, swaps, futures, and currency management
levels.description: Construct option strategies, apply swaps and futures for risk management, and manage currency exposure.

levels.title: Portfolio Construction
levels.subtitle: Equity, fixed-income, and alternative portfolio management
levels.description: Build and manage equity, fixed-income, and alternative investment portfolios for institutional investors.

levels.title: Performance Measurement
levels.subtitle: Performance evaluation, manager selection, and GIPS
levels.description: Evaluate portfolio performance, select investment managers, and apply GIPS standards.

levels.title: Ethical and Professional Standards
levels.subtitle: CFA Institute Code of Ethics and Standards of Practice
levels.description: Apply the CFA Institute Code of Ethics and Standards of Professional Conduct to investment scenarios.

levels.title: Pathway: Portfolio Management
levels.subtitle: Advanced portfolio strategies and private wealth management
levels.description: Advanced strategies in liability-driven investing, yield curve management, credit, equity, and multi-asset portfolios.

levels.title: Pathway: Private Wealth
levels.subtitle: Wealth planning, taxes, estate planning, and risk management
levels.description: Comprehensive wealth planning including taxes, estate planning, concentrated positions, and goals-based investing.

levels.title: Pathway: Private Markets
levels.subtitle: Private equity, debt, real estate, and infrastructure
levels.description: Analyze private equity, debt, real estate, infrastructure, and natural resources investments.

levels.title: Mock Exams
levels.subtitle: Full-length practice exams simulating real test conditions
levels.description: Test your knowledge with full-length mock exams that simulate the actual CFA exam experience.

level-1.title: Asset Allocation
level-1.description: Develop capital market expectations, apply asset allocation frameworks, and understand behavioral finance impacts.

level-1.title: AA.1: Capital Market Expectations: Framework and Macro Considerations
level-1.description: Develop capital market expectations using economic analysis, cross-sectional models, and survey-based methods.

level-1.title: AA.2: Capital Market Expectations: Forecasting
level-1.description: Apply forecasting methods for expected returns, volatility, and correlation across asset classes.

level-1.title: AA.3: Overview of Asset Allocation
level-1.description: Describe asset allocation approaches: asset-only, liability-relative, and goals-based frameworks.

level-1.title: AA.4: Principles of Asset Allocation
level-1.description: Apply mean-variance optimization, Monte Carlo simulation, and risk budgeting to asset allocation.

level-1.title: AA.5: Asset Allocation with Real-World Constraints
level-1.description: Incorporate taxes, transaction costs, regulatory limits, and behavioral factors into asset allocation.

level-1.title: AA.6: Behavioral Finance
level-1.description: Apply behavioral finance concepts to portfolio construction, client management, and market anomalies.

level-1.title: AA: Asset Allocation Practice Drill
level-1.description: 20 practice problems covering Asset Allocation topics.

level-1.title: Asset Allocation Checkpoint
level-1.description: Test your understanding across all Asset Allocation topics.

level-2.title: Derivatives and Risk Management
level-2.description: Construct option strategies, apply swaps and futures for risk management, and manage currency exposure.

level-2.title: DRM.1: Option Strategies
level-2.description: Construct and analyze covered calls, protective puts, spreads, straddles, and collars for portfolio management.

level-2.title: DRM.2: Swaps, Forwards, and Futures Strategies
level-2.description: Apply swaps, forwards, and futures to manage equity, fixed-income, and currency risk in portfolios.

level-2.title: DRM.3: Currency Management: An Introduction
level-2.description: Describe currency risk in portfolios and apply hedging strategies using forwards, options, and cross-hedges.

level-2.title: Derivatives: Risk Management Practice Drill
level-2.description: 20 practice problems covering Derivatives topics for Level III.

level-2.title: Derivatives and Risk Management Checkpoint
level-2.description: Test your understanding across all Derivatives and Risk Management topics.

level-3.title: Portfolio Construction
level-3.description: Build and manage equity, fixed-income, and alternative investment portfolios for institutional investors.

level-3.title: PC.1: Overview of Equity Portfolio Management
level-3.description: Describe passive and active equity strategies, factor-based investing, and equity portfolio construction.

level-3.title: PC.2: Overview of Fixed-Income Portfolio Management
level-3.description: Describe liability-driven, index-based, and active fixed-income strategies for portfolio management.

level-3.title: PC.3: Asset Allocation to Alternative Investments
level-3.description: Integrate alternative investments into a portfolio. Evaluate liquidity, risk, and diversification effects.

level-3.title: PC.4: Portfolio Management for Institutional Investors
level-3.description: Develop investment policies for pensions, endowments, foundations, sovereign wealth funds, and insurance.

level-3.title: PC.5: Trading Costs and Electronic Markets
level-3.description: Analyze trading costs, execution strategies, and the impact of electronic markets on portfolio management.

level-3.title: PC.6: Case Study in Portfolio Management: Institutional
level-3.description: Apply integrated portfolio management concepts to a comprehensive institutional investor case study.

level-3.title: Portfolio Construction Practice Drill
level-3.description: 20 practice problems covering Portfolio Construction topics for Level III.

level-3.title: Portfolio Construction Checkpoint
level-3.description: Test your understanding across all Portfolio Construction topics.

level-4.title: Performance Measurement
level-4.description: Evaluate portfolio performance, select investment managers, and apply GIPS standards.

level-4.title: PERF.1: Portfolio Performance Evaluation
level-4.description: Calculate and interpret portfolio returns, benchmark selection, and risk-adjusted performance measures.

level-4.title: PERF.2: Investment Manager Selection
level-4.description: Describe manager search, selection criteria, due diligence processes, and monitoring frameworks.

level-4.title: PERF.3: Overview of the GIPS Standards
level-4.description: Apply GIPS standards for performance presentation, composite construction, and verification.

level-4.title: Performance Evaluation Practice Drill
level-4.description: 15 practice problems covering Performance Evaluation topics for Level III.

level-4.title: Performance Measurement Checkpoint
level-4.description: Test your understanding across all Performance Measurement topics.

level-5.title: Ethical and Professional Standards
level-5.description: Apply the CFA Institute Code of Ethics and Standards of Professional Conduct to investment scenarios.

level-5.title: ETH.1: Code of Ethics and Standards of Professional Conduct
level-5.description: Apply the Code and Standards to complex Level III portfolio management scenarios.

level-5.title: ETH.2: Guidance for Standards I-VII
level-5.description: Apply detailed guidance for each Standard with emphasis on portfolio management ethical challenges.

level-5.title: ETH.3: Application of the Code and Standards: Level III
level-5.description: Analyze complex portfolio management ethical dilemmas using essay-format case studies.

level-5.title: ETH.4: Asset Manager Code of Professional Conduct
level-5.description: Describe and apply the Asset Manager Code to investment management firm operations.

level-5.title: Ethics: Professional Standards Practice Drill
level-5.description: 20 practice problems covering Ethical and Professional Standards for Level III.

level-5.title: Ethics Checkpoint
level-5.description: Test your understanding across all Level III Ethics topics.

level-6.title: Pathway: Portfolio Management
level-6.description: Advanced strategies in liability-driven investing, yield curve management, credit, equity, and multi-asset portfolios.

level-6.title: PW-PM.1: Liability-Driven and Index-Based Strategies
level-6.description: Construct and manage liability-driven and index-based fixed-income portfolios for institutional investors.

level-6.title: PW-PM.2: Yield Curve Strategies
level-6.description: Implement yield curve positioning strategies including bullet, barbell, and ladder approaches.

level-6.title: PW-PM.3: Fixed-Income Active Management: Credit Strategies
level-6.description: Implement credit-based strategies including investment-grade, high-yield, and structured credit approaches.

level-6.title: PW-PM.4: Active Equity Investing: Strategies
level-6.description: Describe fundamental, quantitative, factor-based, and activist equity investment strategies.

level-6.title: PW-PM.5: Active Equity Investing: Portfolio Construction
level-6.description: Construct active equity portfolios managing tracking error, factor exposures, and position sizing.

level-6.title: PW-PM.6: Multi-Asset Strategies
level-6.description: Construct and manage multi-asset portfolios using tactical allocation, risk parity, and dynamic strategies.

level-6.title: PW-PM.7: Overview of Private Wealth Management
level-6.description: Describe private wealth management including client discovery, IPS development, and tax-efficient strategies.

level-6.title: Pathway: Portfolio Management Practice Drill
level-6.description: 20 practice problems covering the Portfolio Management pathway for Level III.

level-6.title: Portfolio Management Pathway Checkpoint
level-6.description: Test your understanding across all Portfolio Management Pathway topics.

level-7.title: Pathway: Private Wealth
level-7.description: Comprehensive wealth planning including taxes, estate planning, concentrated positions, and goals-based investing.

level-7.title: PW-PW.1: Overview of Private Wealth Management
level-7.description: Describe client types, wealth planning frameworks, and investment policy statement development.

level-7.title: PW-PW.2: Taxes and Private Wealth Management
level-7.description: Analyze the impact of taxes on portfolio returns and apply tax-efficient investment strategies.

level-7.title: PW-PW.3: Estate Planning in a Global Context
level-7.description: Analyze estate planning techniques, wealth transfer strategies, and cross-border considerations.

level-7.title: PW-PW.4: Managing Concentrated Positions
level-7.description: Analyze strategies for managing concentrated stock, real estate, and private business positions.

level-7.title: PW-PW.5: Risk Management for Individuals
level-7.description: Describe human capital, financial capital, and insurance strategies for individual risk management.

level-7.title: PW-PW.6: Goals-Based Investing
level-7.description: Apply goals-based portfolio planning frameworks for private wealth clients with multiple objectives.

level-7.title: PW-PW.7: Private Wealth Client Management
level-7.description: Describe best practices in client communication, behavioral management, and advisor-client relationships.

level-7.title: Pathway: Private Wealth Practice Drill
level-7.description: 20 practice problems covering the Private Wealth pathway for Level III.

level-7.title: Private Wealth Pathway Checkpoint
level-7.description: Test your understanding across all Private Wealth Pathway topics.

level-8.title: Pathway: Private Markets
level-8.description: Analyze private equity, debt, real estate, infrastructure, and natural resources investments.

level-8.title: PW-MK.1: Private Equity Investments
level-8.description: Analyze private equity strategies, fund structures, valuation methods, and performance measurement.

level-8.title: PW-MK.2: Private Debt Investments
level-8.description: Describe private debt strategies, deal structures, credit analysis, and risk-return characteristics.

level-8.title: PW-MK.3: Private Real Estate Investments
level-8.description: Analyze real estate investment structures, valuation approaches, and portfolio construction considerations.

level-8.title: PW-MK.4: Infrastructure Investments
level-8.description: Describe infrastructure investment characteristics, risk-return profiles, and valuation approaches.

level-8.title: PW-MK.5: Natural Resources Investments
level-8.description: Analyze natural resources investments including energy, mining, and agricultural strategies.

level-8.title: PW-MK.6: Special Situations and Distressed Debt
level-8.description: Analyze special situation strategies, distressed debt investing, and turnaround opportunities.

level-8.title: PW-MK.7: Private Markets Portfolio Construction
level-8.description: Construct private markets portfolios considering vintage diversification, liquidity, and J-curve effects.

level-8.title: Pathway: Private Markets Practice Drill
level-8.description: 20 practice problems covering the Private Markets pathway for Level III.

level-8.title: Private Markets Pathway Checkpoint
level-8.description: Test your understanding across all Private Markets Pathway topics.

level-9.title: Mock Exams
level-9.description: Test your knowledge with full-length mock exams that simulate the actual CFA exam experience.

level-9.title: Mock Exam: Constructed Response (Essay)
level-9.description: 8 constructed-response essay scenarios covering key Level III topics. Simulates the morning session format.

level-9.title: Mock Exam: Item Set (Multiple Choice)
level-9.description: 11 item sets with 44 multiple-choice questions covering all Level III topics. Simulates the afternoon session format.
